decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board early on with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets. The deck also utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats. It aims to control the game through disruption and tempo plays, and can quickly close out games with efficient beaters like Tombstalker and Deathrite Shaman. The mana base is designed to support the deck's diverse color requirements and provide access to powerful cards like Liliana of the Veil.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive pace by utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck focuses on tempo play, utilizing cards like Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman to control the opponent's resources and capitalize on small advantages. The mana base is streamlined to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo quickly and efficiently to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Thespian's Stage to quickly find and copy Dark Depths, while also running disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Pithing Needle to protect the combo. The deck also includes cards like Vampire Hexmage and Sylvan Safekeeper to interact with the combo pieces and disrupt opponent's game plan. The goal is to create a huge threat early in the game and overwhelm the opponent before they can react.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through powerful counter spells and removal like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus. It also includes card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to out-value the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Counterbalance and Back to Basics while managing card selection with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. Overall, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantages and powerful late-game threats like Jace and Snapcaster Mage.

The key strategy of this deck revolves around quickly assembling the Dark Depths-Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 flying indestructible Marit Lage token. The deck includes a variety of cards to help search for and protect the combo pieces, disrupt the opponent's game plan with discard spells and Pithing Needle, and generate additional mana with Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide. By efficiently assembling the combo and protecting it from removal or disruption, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

This deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures as quickly as possible, using mana acceleration from cards like City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt opponent's spells, while Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher provide disruption and aggression. The deck also includes utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around playing big threats early and overwhelming the opponent through aggressive plays and disruptive interactions.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Food Chain combo to generate infinite mana and cast powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Tidespout Tyrant. The deck contains a mix of disruption, card draw, and ramp in the form of cards like Force of Will, Brainstorm, and Noble Hierarch. It also includes a variety of creatures with enters-the-battlefield effects to control the board and generate advantage. The deck aims to assemble the combo quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also setting up a win condition with cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. It utilizes cards like Gamble and Crop Rotation to search for key pieces, while also having access to removal like Punishing Fire and disruption with Wasteland and Rishadan Port. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by recurring lands with Life from the Loam and creating a lock with cards like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Glacial Chasm.

This UWx Control deck focuses heavily on card manipulation and countering opponent's spells. The deck includes a variety of card draw and selection spells like Ponder, Portent, and Brainstorm to set up powerful plays. The key strategy is to control the board with removal spells like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares, while using Counterbalance and Force of Will to counter any threats. The deck also includes win conditions like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland to disrupt opponents while maintaining a strong Aggro strategy. The deck also includes utility cards like Umezawa's Jitte for additional damage and Karn, Scion of Urza for card advantage. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient Eldrazi creatures while maintaining control of the game with disruptive elements.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through various counterspells and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, Terminus, and Supreme Verdict. It also runs card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Portent to ensure consistency and access to key cards. The win condition is typically through a combination of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, along with creature tokens generated by Entreat the Angels. The deck also has a strong mana denial strategy with cards like Back to Basics and Counterbalance to disrupt opponents' game plans.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck aims to efficiently disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to generate advantage. Stoneforge Mystic helps to tutor for the necessary equipment, while True-Name Nemesis poses a threat that is difficult for many decks to deal with. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors for versatility in casting spells.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to aggressively control the board with a mix of cheap spells like Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Daze, while also generating value through card advantage with Brainstorm, Gitaxian Probe, and Young Pyromancer. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal, while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler to quickly close out the game. Wasteland is also included to disrupt the opponent's mana base and keep them off balance.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly by playing cheap efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis. By combining this with disruption from cards like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Wasteland, the deck aims to control the game tempo and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck also utilizes powerful graveyard synergies with Deathrite Shaman and Gurmag Angler to give it additional reach and versatility in different match-ups.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy and win conditions. By using cards like Wasteland, Ghost Quarter, and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale, the deck aims to deprive the opponent of resources while also utilizing lands like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful win condition. Life from the Loam and Crop Rotation are key cards in this strategy, allowing the player to recur lands and find the necessary pieces for their game plan. Overall, the deck's goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent by leveraging the power of lands.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence with aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while disrupting opponents with cards like Gaddock Teeg and Thalia. The deck is also able to generate card advantage and utility through cards like Sylvan Library and Stoneforge Mystic. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Deathrite Shaman, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient threats and disruption, while also being able to adapt to different situations with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Scryb Ranger.
